resources.string: The ScreenReader app helps you with learning TalkBack.
TalkBack is an essential accessibility feature for visually impaired and blind people to control their devices.
By using gestures you can navigate between elements on the screen. Each element is announced as it is selected.
This allows you to control your device even if you can\'t see the screen.
The ScreenReader app helps you learn all TalkBack gestures. In addition, you can learn some common actions.
Are you dependent on the screen reader? This app can help you to improve your skills.
Are you an app dveloper? Use the learnings to improve the accessibility of your apps.
Open the \'Settings\' app, select \'Accessibility\', select \'TalkBack\' and turn on the switch.
Note: from this point on, you need to swipe to navigate and double tap to activate.
Are these steps not correct for your device? Search for \'TalkBack\' to jump to the correct screen.
Open the \'Settings\' app, select \'Accessibility\', select \'TalkBack\' and turn off the switch. Or search for \'TalkBack\' to jump to this screen.
It is possible add a shortcut to toggle TalkBack on or off.
Open the \'Settings\'-app, select \'Accessibility\', select \'Advanced settings\', select \'Volume up and down keys\' and choose \'TalkBack\'.
Press and hold the volume up and down buttons for 3 seconds to turn TalkBack on or off.
The ScreenReader app is an initiative of the Appt Foundation. The app has been developed by Abra. The app was made possible by a contribution from the SIDN fund.
Download the free ScreenReader app at https://screenreader.app and learn how to use the screen reader!
You can learn all TalkBack gestures on this screen. Select a gesture to learn how to perform it. You can practice gestures via the \'Practice\'-button.
Do you want to practice with or without instructions?
Touch the screen instead of swiping.
You swiped the screen instead of tapping.
Tap with %d fingers instead of %d fingers.
Press and hold the screen longer after tapping.
Press and hold the screen for a shorter time after tapping.
You performed the gestures incorrectly for %d times.

Swipe left to stop.

Swipe right to continue.

Swipe left to stop.

Swipe down to skip.

Swip right to continue.
\n\nDo you want to continue or stop?
\n\nDo you want to continue, skip or stop?
When you touch the screen, the content below your finger is read aloud. This is a handy way to discover how the screen is built.
Swiping up takes you to the previous setting. For example, you can activate navigation by links. Or you can increase the value of a slider.
Swiping down takes you to the next setting. For example, you can activate navigation via headings. Or you can decrease the value of a slider.
By swiping to the right you explore the screen from left to right and then from top to bottom.
By swiping to the left you explore the screen from right to left and then from bottom to top.
In lists, you can scroll up with this gesture.
In lists, you can scroll down with this gesture.
In lists, you can use this gesture to scroll to the right. Sometimes you can also navigate to the next screen with this gesture.
In lists, you can use this gesture to scroll left. Sometimes you can also navigate to the previous screen with this gesture.
Go to the previous reading setting
Use this gesture to jump to the previous reading setting, for example from \'Headings\' to \'Links\'.
Go to the next reading setting
Use this gesture to jump to the next reading setting, for example from \'Links\' to \'Headings\'.
Tap the screen 2 times with 1 finger.
By tapping the screen twice, you can activate items, such as a button.
Tap 2 times with 1 finger and hold for 3 seconds.
In many apps, a menu of options appears when you use this gesture. In a list, you can usually perform actions on the selected item this way.
Tap the screen 3 times with 1 finger
Some apps require double-tapping to perform certain actions.
This gesture allows you to pause or resume TalkBack speech.
Tap the screen with 2 times with 2 fingers.
Use this gesture to start or stop actions such as phone calls and media. You can also accept or reject a phone call. And you can pause or resume videos.
Tap 2 times with 2 finger and hold for 3 seconds.
You can use this gesture when you want to quickly select or deselect text.
Tap the screen 3 times with 2 fingers.
Use this gesture to read all content on the screen aloud from the item you selected.
Tap the screen once with 3 fingers
The TalkBack menu allows you to perform actions on the selected element.
This gesture is the fastest way to copy text.
Tap the screen 2 times with 3 fingers and hold for 3 seconds.
This gesture is the fastest way to cut text.
Tap the screen 3 times with 3 fingers.
This gesture is the fastest way to paste text.
Tap the screen once with 4 fingers
After you use this gesture, the TalkBack gesture practice mode opens.
Tap the screen 2 times with 4 fingers.
After using this gesture, information appears to help you with using TalkBack.
Tap the screen 2 times with 4 fingers and hold for 3 seconds.
After you use this gesture, all the touches are passed directly to the app. This allows you to draw you signature, for example.
Use 1 finger to swipe down and then up, in a fluid motion.
This gesture allows you to jump directly to the last item on the screen. In many apps, a button to perform an action is positioned as the last element.
Use 1 finger to swipe up and then down, in a fluid motion.
This gesture allows you to jump directly to the first element on the screen. In many apps, this is the back button to go to the previous screen.
Use 1 finger to swipe right and then left, in a fluid motion.
This gesture allows you to scroll forward a little bit. You can also do this by swiping down with two fingers.
Use 1 finger to swipe left and then right, in a fluid motion.
This gesture allows you to scroll back a little bit. You can also do this by swiping up with two fingers.
Use 1 finger to swipe down and then left, in a fluid motion.
This gesture is important to remember! You can use this gesture to navigate to the previous screen most apps. In addition, you can also close notifications and popups.
Use 1 finger to swipe up and then left, in a fluid motion.
This gesture is fastest way to get back to the home screen.
Use 1 finger to swipe left and then up, in a fluid motion.
This is the fastest way to view your recent apps.
Use 1 finger to swipe right and then down, in a fluid motion.
This is the fastest way to view your notifications. You can also swipe down at the top of the screen with two fingers.
Use 1 finger to swipe left and then down, in a fluid motion.

This is an important gesture to remember. After you perform this gesture, a search window appears. Type what you are looking for. A list of search results appears below the search box. Swipe to the right until you select the desired search result. Double-tap make the focus jump to this search result.
Use 1 finger to swipe down and then right, in a fluid motion.
A menu of actions appears after you use this gesture. The options include having the screen content read aloud, or to copy the last utterance to the clipboard.
You can learn several TalkBack actions on this screen. We recommend to first learn all gestures, to make sure you can perform these actions properly.
You need to enable TalkBack for this training.
TalkBack allows you to navigate by headings. This is useful for long pages or websites.
This is how you navigate by headings:
1. Set the navigation setting to \'Headings\' by swiping up and down with 1 finger in a smooth motion. Do this several times until you hear \'Headings\'.
2. Swipe down with 1 finger to navigate to the next heading. Or swipe up with 1 finger to navigate to the previous heading.
Navigate by headings 3 times to complete the training.
This text is skipped when you navigate by headings.
TalkBack allows you to navigate by links. This is useful for finding information such as websites and phone numbers.
This is how you navigate by links:
1. Set the navigation setting to \'Links\' by swiping up and down with 1 finger in a smooth motion. Do this several times until you hear \'Links\'.
2. Swipe down with 1 finger to navigate to the next link. Or swipe up with 1 finger to navigate to the previous link.
Navigate by links 3 times to complete the training.
This text is skipped when you navigate by links.
TalkBack allows you to select text by using the context menu.
This is how you select text:
1. Highlight the field where you want to select text.
2. Swipe down and then right in a fluid motion to open the context menu.
Select all text from the edit box below to complete the training.
TalkBack allows you to copy text by using the context menu.
This is how you copy text:
1. Highlight the field where you want to copy text.
2. Swipe down and then right in a fluid motion to open the context menu.
5. Swipe down and then right in a fluid motion to open the context menu again.
Copy all the text from the edit box below to complete the training.
Copy text from the input field.
TalkBack allows you to paste text by using the context menu.
This is how you paste text:
1. Highlight the field where you want to paste text.
2. Double tap with 1 finger and hold the screen for 3 seconds. Then release your finger to start editing.
3. Swipe down and then right in a fluid motion to open the context menu.
Paste text into the edit box below to complete the training.
Recognizing gestures in the ScreenReader app

This service must be activated to allow the ScreenReader app to recognize gestures.

The gesture training is automatically started when you turn on this service.

The service is automatically disabled when you stop the training or switch to another app.

No data is stored.
The ScreenReader service has been turned off automatically.
The ScreenReader service is turned off. The service must be turned on to allow the ScreenReader app to recognize gestures.
Due to technical limitations, you can only use the \'Practice\' option when TalkBack is enabled at this time.

You need to enable the 'ScreenReader gestures' service to allow the ScreenReader app to recognize gestures when TalkBack is activated.

Follow these steps:

1. Navigate to the 'Activate' button. Double-tap to open the accessibility settings of your device.

2. Navigate to installed service named 'ScreenReader gestures'. Double tap to open the settings screen.

3. Navigate to the switch. Double-tap to enable the service.

4. Navigate to the 'Allow' option. Double tap to activate the service.

5. You have successfully completed the activation process. The gesture training should start automatically.
Due to technical limitations, you can\'t practice gestures while TalkBack is enabled at this time.
